intro: Tragium hirtellum, commonly known as the hairy tragia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its hairy stems and leaves are adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Tragium hirtellum produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer.
